Good, even though i prefer 2033

Quite a dissapointment compared to Metro 2033. Some say its an improvement but I dont feel it. Played on the hardest difficulty on both games (Survival and hardcore I think it is) and feelt that Metro 2033 gave an fair experience. You can kill allmost any enemy (human) with 1-2 bullets but they can also easily kill you. But in this game I feelt that the enemy allways outnumbered me, made me empty my magasines, broke my gasmask etc.
Plus the stealth mechanics are weird, enemies could walk into me without spotting me in the dark, but they can see a dead corpse behind a dumspter miles away.  

I aslo tried going towards the good ending in this game, I saved prisoners, donated money to beggars, gave away a teddy bear, spared SEVERAL surrendering enemies, saved innocents from getting killed and raped by bandits, did not attack hungry and vile beasts if they would not attack first, listened and eavesdroped on a ton of conversations, and even though a huge fucking bear tried to kill me I saved its life afterwards. 
Even though I did do all of these things I got the bad ending. I set up myself for a worse playing experience to receive a special outcome from this game, and didnt even receive it. 
If you cant have fun while playing a game and get a good ending at the same time, its not your fault its the developers fault. The witcher 3 for example gave me a great playing experience and story meanwhile also rewarded me a the best ending. 

Some games allways label the players Good or Bad depending on how they play the game, the more fun the experience is, the more evil you are, the more boring and lame experience you have the better you are as a person (Metro games and Dishonored Games example). Dishonored the game were you play as an assassin, welp if you actually assassinate people you get a worse fucking ending... frick you for trying to have fun!

The story was mediocre at best, random love interest out of nowhere (probably cause the game only hade one woman character), had only two likeable charachters, the bad guys motives was bassically "Im the bad guy" and "coomunism". The first game was based on the book meanwhile this game is not I think, can hence explain why the story is lacking. 

The graphics are good for its age, and it brings out the dark and horror feelings from the Metro in a good way, I have only read one Metro book and I feel like the games translate the written words into code quite well. This game has some big flaws, like story, difficulty and the choice of the ending the game gives you, but besides that if you do not try to go after a true Metro survival experience as I did, it will act as as normal, fun stealth action game. 

If you wanna play Metro any of the Metro games, I would recommend Metro Exodus or Metro 2033. 

This was my experience of the game, most people like Metro Last Light and they probaly do that for good reasons, if you buy this game I hope your experience will be better than mine :)

Metro: Last Light Redux is one of the best story driven FPS games I have ever played. The story is interesting and enjoyable and kept me captivated for hours on end. They managed to create a unique and scary atmosphere enhanced with great sound effects. 

It plays more like a shooter compared to its predecessor Metro 2033.

Graphics are excellent and the environments are detailed and fun to explore. The people you meet are interesting with meaningful backgrounds and great voice acting. Combat is enjoyable and fluid with a good amount of different weapons. 

I am really happy with all the small little details they added to the gameplay, like wiping you gasmask, changing the air filter when you hear heavier breathing, or charging your pneumatic weapons. 

As someone who enjoys sneaking in games, I am really happy with the option to avoid combat altogether or take out the enemies in a stealthy manner.
If you enjoy post apocolyptic russian affairs then you'll love it. I know I loved the first one and this one. Class lighting as well.

If you are looking for a fast paced FPS no brainer then this game is not it. But if you like nice story, post-apocalyptic world to explore, tactical combat with some planning, like to craft a bit and having few decisions then you will hardly find better games. For me Metro games are one of the best FPS games that were ever created. I just finished playing all 3 games twice in a row. It was a bliss. The deepness of the experience I felt was awesome. First of all as you most probably know this is based on a book and you will feel it. The graphics in Metro games really capture the spirit of aged metro stations and fallout in the wind of wasteland of Moscow, but donтАЩt forget masterfully presented citizens both alive and dead plus local fauna and flora. And itтАЩs not so greenish as new Fallouts. Audio is great too, radios, folk music, subway performers, sounds, cries. Weapons are simply great. Divers, versatile, upgradeable, close combat, medium range, long range, pick one. Stealth or carnage are both possible. Tikhar is maybe one of the best friends a sniper can hope for. Steal balls as ammo, high pressure to spit it out тАУ IтАЩm in тАУ only down side you have to headshot. Yeah baby, pump it up!!! I like the style of difficulties as they are presented. Survival or Spartan and after further branching. I missed it in third game. The game boost also Ranger HC mode for the real immersion removing HUD and all sort of help/hints, improving dmg of you and everyone and making found resources even scarce. Metro games are highly immersive so adrenalin junkies blow your socks off. But fair to mention that even on harder difficulties itтАЩs still easy for any experienced FPS player. Resources are abundant if you loot everything you can find ;) 
Each enemy has its own style of fighting and strengths/weaknesses and has a nice place in the game. As you travel you will encounter various factions of metro, communists, nazis, traders, rogues, bandits, citizens, Spartans. You will be accompanied thru most of the game by an NPC and they will add to the atmosphere as the persons have something meaningful to say, inform you about some metro facts, history, give you advice on the progress. It makes the world feel more alive. AI is really good. The difficulties make a big difference in all the fields. While it is very hard to make some levels stealthy on hard diff, it is quite easier on normal. To stealthy kill or even stun everyone on hard is doable, much harder to go without even stun. Enemies will react on each situation more sensitively. 
There is only one thing that I hate. Scripts. In some places the script is simply not believable. Like in some situations all enemies know exactly where you are and are able to sharpshoot with weapons that do not have such precision. You are shooting from behind two covers, so thru two holes and still bullets fly insanely close. Things like this destroy the immersion and reality. And frustration starts to build. Also not to be able to save in certain points makes up for recalling console strategy тАУ which shouldnтАЩt go un-criticized by people. This is a PC, it can handle save and the structure of the game allows for it. I understand if you couldnтАЩt save in some places, like bosses and such. 
For me the atmosphere of the game is the best thing here, but if other parts would be mediocre I would be sad, which is not the case, so let me focus on that. Atmosphere is increased ten folds with presence of characters тАУ no joke. First you have kind of a reminder about events from last Metro, stroll thru Spartan base and the people do not give you the credit you deserve based on your performance until now, you meet majority of characters: Khan, Ulman, Miller in a briefing room plus some new like Anna and you set of to explore this beautiful treat of a game *SPOILER ALERT start* Anna will become your future wife and Miller you father in law and it will turn up just great in 3rd game, only too bad Ulman and Khan are not there *SPOILER ALERT end* Again there is Pavel, but this time a commie Pavel. Lovable character really. The plot of the second game is even better then the first. You can even visit the brain behind proletariat. Try to find him when on Red Square. I still wonder who is maintaining all the wooden contraptions in few level, but I like the design. Some levels in this game are like playgarden for destruction. The things you can do and the weapons you can use. Possibility for moral choices is here as well. Two possible ends. This time the good end is the codex ending. To obtain good end you simply have to explore the world, be curios, listen to people worries and care about the world. 
Then there are DLC and I love them all. I bought the game as a bundle, so not sure how it worked before but when you can have it for few Euro then go for it. Each story is worth at least 2 E in my book. For example Kshatriya or Spider Lair or Khan or Sniper or Pavel are such great levels. Only Two towers is out of the bag of treats as a spinach or similar. It is simply not with the spirit of Metro game. Enjoy one of the few gems in the FPS mountain. Good that there are 3 games :)

I love this game the story and gameplay, same as a review i made about metro 2033 i played it in one sit because i didnt want to stop playing. 

!But there was 1 BIG problem, the first time i started it up and pressed new game it crashed. 2nd try it didn't then i played the game until the last mission (at d6) when it suddenly crashed for the 2nd time, after restarting it again it crashed each time. so i looked for some way to fix it i used steam forums, but every single thing i tried failed eventually it just started working again so i finished it, but i just don't understand how it can play almost the entire game then crash everytime you start it up and then just work again!

First two metro games are amazing. But the Exodus is probably the best gaming experience I've had in such a long time. I can't describe the feelings I have for Exodus and the metro series. Definitely play the two games first. Then play Exodus. If I were to write good things about these game series, it'd result in huge paragraphs but I genuinely feel like Metro games are one of the best games I've ever played.

Less scary, a bit easier and more about the people rather than the mutants in comparision to Metro 2033, which suits me, personally.
I liked this game more than the prequel, it wasn't so punishing and more pleasant to play. I didn't need to take a short break after every mission. Or maybe it's thanks to experience I gained from the Metro 2033, can't tell.
Still no quick saves, respawn is based on checkpoints, but it feels like the autosaves pop up more often and after a key moments, so you probably won't be forced to chop through half of the mission again after being killed.
Small tip at the end - If you encounter a TRAIN shoot it in the wheels. Yeah, who would have thought. The game doesn't tell you shit of course, but Metro 2033 made me used to it already.
It's a great game tho! Definitely worth it.

I jumped into Last Light Redux 10 minutes after completing 2033 Redux, I was so thrilled with first game.  I enjoyed where they went with this story and the continued drama in the world of Metro.  However, as before, I felt the entire "Dark One" part of the world was never really fleshed out or explained in these two games.  I am assuming there is more details in the actual books.

As with 2033, the environments and scenarios are very details and often gorgeous to view.  Combat was still fun and exciting for me... and sometimes stressful.  

If you enjoyed the first game, I would definitely recommend playing Last Light.  Seeing what happened in the community of Metro after the discoveries at the end of 2033, and being a part of it, was a great experience.  This was an excellent follow up.

Absolutely amazing, from start to finish. The gameplay and weapon handling is very reminiscent of F.E.A.R. So are some of the supernatural elements.

The story is compelling and the characters are all unique and attaching in their own way.

I just loved the atmosphere so much, I'm on my fourth playthrough as we speak. Had to grind to get all the main story achievements, good ending, bad ending, ranger, ranger hardcore.
 
The karma system is a nice twist as well. A nice way to motivate the player to just stop and listen (or watch a truely aweful show at the Bolshoi Theatre :D) 

The music and the voice acting are engaging. Some story element really punched me in the gut. A third of the way through the game I was swearing at the writers for luring me into a false sense of companionship. Goddamn, betrayal stings like a b****

I've been delaying moving on to Exodus because I got so engrossed in Last light but I guess I can't put it out any longer :P

Metro: Last Light I liked much more than Metro 2033. Technically: there are much fewer bugs than in the 1st part, but they still occur. The plot is more interesting, though simple. As for me, the game has become even more atmospheric, as more horror elements have been added.

Awesome (once).

Just like Metro 2033, another great game (first time around) in the series. 

If you are into S.T.A.L.K.E.R. games then this is really quite an amazing Action Adventure the first time you play it and the accent is quite refreshing too. Looks great, combat is fun and challenging and story is intriguing and the whole atmosphere is very well done. Unfortunately it's quite short like forty hours or so and even though you can replay different chapters I find the replay value to be quite low in regards to the story, because it's quite linear in story even though there are some tactical choices, it's not RPG and there are no dialogue choices. I don't know what it is exactly about the Metro games, but they remind me so much of Half Life and the story is just phenomenal.

P.S. Moral points are just as obnoxious in this game and there's a game-breaking bug that takes away the stealth in one of the later missions. It's just annoying that it punishes you for trying to do the right thing. The bug is that more than halfway into the game at the Contagion level it takes away the prompt for non-lethal and lethal takedowns. So your only option is killing them all. 
Other glitches are also annoying where you can get stuck in a tight spot, you can't move any longer and the game will autosave you, meaning you have to go through the entire chapter from the beginning and watch all of the unskippable cutscenes. 

It's a great game, but it's pretty broken.

Last light feels a lot more cohesive than 2033. 2033 felt a lot like you were just going from place to place because NPC's tell you to and the NPC handholding in 2033 is quite prolific. Last Light thankfully let's you off the training wheels and experience the game on your own. The story feels like there's an overall purpose and the writing just seems better. Out of the whole franchise I feel Last Light is the best one.

This series is great, and while Last Light has plenty of annoying parts (especially on harder difficulties) there's just too much good here to discredit the entire game. It takes some genuinely scary games to give you a arsenal creative weapons and still scare the shit out of you.

Metro Last Light feels like an attempt at an evolution of Metro 2033. And in some small, but noticable ways it is. Gameplay wise, theres more weapons, though a few unfortunately don't return like the Bigun as far as I can tell, aside from in the Developer level apparently. But they aren't really given their due. I played on survivor and normal, and I never got enough ammo to justify the Valve I always carried around. The game very obviously encourages a few kinds of weapons, namely 5.45 rifles and to a slightly lesser extent, shotguns. Pistols that use .44 Magnum seem like they'd be very difficult to use if you're not killing everyone in one or two shots.

While the story is quite good, and I feel even better than in 2033, the ending was an unsatisfying letdown, and I felt like the choices I made had pretty much no impact because I wouldn't have been given the option to choose anything else if I'd tried.

Amazing game for its time. The story arc from the 1st game to this one, the tone shift, and everything was just perfect. This game will have you hooked until the very end. Amazing message and overall theme as well. Highly recommend playing Metro 2033 1st if you havent yet, and are thinking of playing this one. Metro 2033 is still the OG Metro game. And my favorite still out of the 3 Metro games.

It is a decent game. But it is worse than Metro 2033 in every. single. way.
At Metro 2033 the non-combat scenes were extremely powerful, whereas at Last Light they are quite bad and the game only gets better when you're in combat. However, combat is worse than the combat from Metro 2033 too, especially because of the level design. So, yeah.

So, the summary is: Play Metro 2033 first. And if you want more of that, then play this one. It is still a worthwhile game, despite being worse than Metro 2033.

I played Metro when I was younger, and I have recently played through both the old ones. While I was playing 2033 I kept waiting for all the good stuff I remember, but it never came. Why was that? Because it was all in Last Light. Now don't get me wrong I'm not saying 2033 is bad, because it isn't (it is fantastic, the Frontline level in particular), but I am saying that Metro: Last Light is significantly better (which is saying something because of how good the first is).

There is also far more content in this game than I remembered. The base game is around ten hours of gameplay, and each DLC is around an hour. Speaking of the DLC, if you were to get this game for any reason at all, it should be for the DLC. The Chronicles Pack (Anna, Khan, and Pavel) missions are whatever, the Tower Pack is too difficult, the Developer Pack is somewhat interesting, but the Faction Pack (Heavy Squad, Kshatriya, and Sniper Team) is where it's at. Of all the time I put into this game, those playing the Faction Pack were the most enjoyable.

Anyway, what about the actual game? I cannot recommend it more to anyway that is interested in shooters. Metro allows you to choose a play style, on that focuses on survival and one that focuses on combat, accommodating to both types of players. The gameplay is very satisfying, the story is actually interesting, and the combat/stealth is enjoyable.
